original_text: The following Q&As provide information for consumers about Digital Mammography. Frequently Asked Questions: What is digital mammography? What is DBT? How can women find an FDA-certified digital mammog...

qa_pairs.output: Digital mammography is a mammography system where the X-ray film is replaced by solid-state detectors that convert X-rays into electrical signals used to produce breast images viewable on a computer screen or printed on special films.
DBT involves moving the X-ray tube in an arc around the breast to capture multiple images from different angles, allowing physicians to see through layers of overlapping tissue.

qa_pairs.text_input: How can women find an FDA-certified digital mammography facility?
qa_pairs.output: A list of certified facilities searchable by state or ZIP code can be found at https://www.fda.gov/radiation-emitting-products/mammography-quality-standards-act-mqsa/find-certified-mammography-facility
